page.title: 17WANLIP SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: Wanlip Water Reclamation Works is run by the Severn Trent Water Authority. It was opened in 1964 and serves a population of 305,00 from Leicester as far as Groby and Markfield. The plant employs 100 workers and plans are in hand to meet the expected increase in population. Planning for the future is very important, they are planning for new developments up to 2030. Liquid waste is treated and then fed into the River Soar. Solid waste produces methane gas which is used on site to power the plant. The remaining solid waste is sold as a fertiliser called Lescost. There is little smell from the works and the authority displays great concern about the environment. They were very pleased to talk to us and gave us leaflets to study.
